roleset.name: be astounded
roleset.note: REEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'reel' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Well butter my butt and call me a biscuit, it is in verbnet: class 40.8.2. No mention of other members. Comparison to ergative usage of 'shake'. (from reel.01-v)

example.name: ordinary ergative
example.text: For, just as Mr. Giuliani latches on to an issue that has Mr. Dinkins reeling, ...

example.name: with cause
example.text: [Columbia Savings& Loan Association]-1, *trace*-1 reeling from thrift-accounting changes mandated by Congress and the recent collapse of the junk-bond market, announced a loss for the third quarter of $226.3 million, or $11.57 a share.
example.arg: from thrift-accounting changes mandated by Congress and the recent collapse of the junk-bond market

roleset.name: bring, put somewhere like a fish
roleset.note: REEL-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in CallHome. Framed by Claire. (from reel.03-v)

example.name: With direction only
example.text: And if he does I think she 'll reel him right back in.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: John reeled the fish in onto the shore but he didn't know how to remove the hook from its mouth.

roleset.name: enumerate, announce
roleset.note: REEL_OFF-V NOTES: This is an odd usage of 'reel off', imho. (from reel.02-v)

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: The U.S. automotive loss was a sharp reversal for a company that *trace* had reeled off 12 consecutive quarters of improved earnings until the 1989 second quarter.
